name: NewYorker
text: In 1989, some 200,000 pro-democracy students called for government accountability and the freedom of the press in Beijing’s Tiananmen Square. Revisit photographs from the protests and the government crackdown that followed. https://t.co/Fbs0Mdfvbz

name: NewYorker
text: After Mayor Bill de Blasio announced a citywide curfew, thousands of demonstrators responded by staying outside for as long as they could. https://t.co/9SaE4EcG6X

name: NewYorker
text: Remember when we used to squeeze our bodies together? https://t.co/pLVnEbBvg3

name: NewYorker
text:
An organizer and anti-racism trainer discusses the origins and effects of structural racism, and whether the current demonstrations could be a turning point for the country. Listen here.

https://t.co/DJo9N9u9d4

name: NewYorker
text:
"He visited in January and left behind a jar of peanut butter and a bottle of vermouth. That may be all I see of him for a while." Matthew Klam writes about a friendship that has lasted since 8th grade. 
https://t.co/j6KTB8HKLF

name: NewYorker
text:
“I stepped toward him, away from the platform edge, right as the train arrived. I felt the breeze at my back,” Ottessa Moshfegh writes. “I understood that this man had appeared just in time to save my life.”
https://t.co/4u2xIPqUha

name: NewYorker
text: "I can’t remember when I last read a novel that so quickly dismantled the ordinary skepticism that attends the reading of made-up stories," James Wood writes, of @MeghaMaj’s first novel, “A Burning." https://t.co/Xth8AwXcf2

name: NewYorker
text: “I’ll walk all night,” one demonstrator vowed, as a group of several hundred marchers turned down Washington Avenue in Crown Heights, chanting, “Fuck the curfew.” https://t.co/jVJgyvKHdL

name: NewYorker
text: “The argument that black crime is the cause of reactionary policing is among the aged and easily refuted clichés of American racial history,” Jelani Cobb wrote after a grand jury failed to indict the police officer who killed Eric Garner, in 2014. https://t.co/xVPlQP5JUH

name: NewYorker
text: “What I found from the 1960s is that nonviolent protest achieved many of the same sorts of outcomes that the more militant activists were fighting for without splintering the Democratic coalition.” An interview with @owasow. https://t.co/enEp5qp3Nd

name: NewYorker
text: In Eléonore Hamelin’s new short film, the Reverend Sharon Risher, whose mother and two cousins were killed in the 2015 mass murder at the Emanuel A.M.E. Church, describes how activism has helped lift her out of her grief. https://t.co/OyH6wg3VWi

name: NewYorker
text: At his recent Zoom town hall, Barack Obama never mentioned Donald Trump by name. That was striking, on a day when Trump’s former Defense Secretary, James Mattis, put out an appalled statement about the President. https://t.co/Ix4sIOowLK

name: NewYorker
text:
RT @stevesweatpants: W/ all this crazy shit that’s happening in the world, I feel like it’s my job to tell the truth for my people. 

Beyond honored to be on my first assignment w/ the @NewYorker. You can find my work in the article below.

#BlackLivesMatter 

>>

https://t.co/LxlCJiNT5W
